name: UGANDA LOCAL GOVERNMENTS ASSOCIATION
goal:
ULGA’s mandate is to unite Local Governments, and provide them with Association member services, and a forum through which to come together and give each other support and guidance to make common positions on key issues that affect local governance. ULGA carries out this mandate through lobbying, advocacy and representation of Local Governments at local, National and International platforms.

ULGA’s main function is to advocate and negotiate for the interests of the Local Governments and its ultimate goal is to promote and build Democratic and Accountable Local Governments capable of delivering Efficient and Sustainable Public Services to the people.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Business and Industry, Communication, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Food Safety, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
